text: hi I'm Melissa Clark from the dining
section when you get a bunch of broccoli
rabe you steam it or maybe you saute it
but I'm going to show you how to roast
it what you can roast broccoli rabe yes
you can
and it's delicious of course the first
thing you need to do is clean your
broccoli rabe what you want to do is
find that place where the stem meets the
stalk and then you just want to cut it
right off I'm getting rid of the woody
bottom part not so tasty but I'm gonna
leave all these beautiful green leaves
which aren't now I'm just going to give
these a quick rinse so these are clean
there's just a little bit of water still
clinging to them you want that just
spread them out in one layer on a baking
pan now I'm gonna drizzle them with oil
and season with some salt and pepper now
I'm just gonna toss it with my hands
it's good to use your hands for this
because that way you'll be able to
really tell when all of the rabe is
evenly coated now I'm gonna pop this in
a 500-degree oven for about five to ten
minutes until the rabe is tender but the
edges are singed so here we go these are
done I'm just gonna squeeze some lemon
over the top you could use cheese maybe
some parmesan curls or you know if you
happen to have any homemade ricotta at
home these are great on their own too as
a side dish just pair it up with roasted
meats maybe a roast chicken or eat them
straight they're as good as they look
